intro: Spilanthes mandonii, commonly known as the desert tansy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Spilanthes mandonii is often found in scrubland and grassland habitats, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
